summary:
- Views and viewpoints are used to structure complex architectural structures.
- Views are used to describe different aspects of the system, while viewpoints provide templates for the views.
- Viewpoints and views help organize the process and the artifacts produced.
- The concept of architectural viewpoints has academic roots back to the 1970s.
- Several sets of viewpoints have been developed, including the 4+1 description by Philippe Kruchten and the RM-ODP viewpoint set.
- Christine Hofmeister, Rod Nord, and Dilip Soni defined a set of viewpoints for real-time and embedded systems. - Book "Applied Software Architecture" was published in 1999.
- Book "Large Scale Software Architecture" was published in 2003.
- Book "Software Systems Architecture: Working With Stakeholders Using Viewpoints and Perspectives" was published in 2005.
- ISO Standard 42010 is based on the conceptual model for how viewpoints and views relate to each other.
- ISO Standard 42010 is a development of the previous IEEE Standard 1471.
